verses.verse: The Joy of ForgivenessA Psalm of David. A Maskil. Blessed is he whose transgression is forgiven, whose sin is covered.
Blessed is the man to whom the LORD imputes no iniquity, and in whose spirit there is no deceit.
When I declared not my sin, my body wasted away through my groaning all day long.
For day and night thy hand was heavy upon me; my strength was dried up (Heb obscure) as by the heat of summer. Selah
I acknowledged my sin to thee, and I did not hide my iniquity; I said, “I will confess my trangressions to the LORD”; then thou didst forgive the guilt of my sin. Selah
Therefore let every one who is godly offer prayer to thee; at a time of distress, (Cn: Heb at a time of finding only) in the rush of great waters, they shall not reach him.
Thou art a hiding place for me, thou preservest me from trouble; thou dost encompass me with deliverance. (Cn: Heb shouts of deliverance) Selah
I will instruct you and teach you the way you should go; I will counsel you with my eye upon you.
Be not like a horse or a mule, without understanding, which must be curbed with bit and bridle, else it will not keep with you.
Many are the pangs of the wicked; but steadfast love surrounds him who trusts in the LORD.
Be glad in the LORD, and rejoice, O righteous, and shout for joy, all you upright in heart!
